280C20DF0860440CA871D58E3EABADFB.description: Listen to, recite, or sing poetry.

11CB61F2A53F4D17A04A146BECEA6F8C.description: Confirm the accuracy of information presented in non-fiction texts.

865ACA80666C40FDB8F8F4523057EC18.description: Provide personal opinions regarding the structure, content, or source of information expressed in non-fiction texts.

8D59D3FA4F674ABA9279674E774639DF.description: Investigate ways that non-fiction texts can be organized to enhance the presentation of factual information.

A25D515956EA4307A97F8F4A1732C5BD.description: Describe the protagonist and antagonist in a variety of fictional texts.

635BAEAAD5244FBBA4FC5F9BB22E65F8.description: Examine characters based on what they say, think, or do or what others say and think about them.

45F0A11EB0A4422A8C593FBD73BC5DDA.description: Examine elements within a variety of fictional texts, including conflict.

C8A0C66FDFB74D6FAA2C0857DD76F565.description: Examine a variety of fictional text structures, including a story within a story.

F34FC376BF9346E6B5757872E53BA192.description: Examine mentor texts to deepen understandings of fiction sub-genres.

A024F6302C9B4C70A740DA2B88F21E9B.description: Include a variety of text features to help organize content, identify important information, and enhance personal expression.

D39D854E45C747F0ACD58E3233D9BC7C.description: Examine a variety of text features that organize content, identify important information, and enhance understandings of texts.

21EFF4A91F7544888A843B7037F1EA91.description: Make connections between texts read for enjoyment and academic development.

AA9F5C1987B74EA0852BA546B8B362E2.description: Examine the form and structure of a variety of literary texts.

50B0EA9A60484204A59BBAFC0DFE615E.description: Land literacy can be enhanced through examining human-made structures of land.

DB992FB5A9F34649B0F1050B8E2AE7E8.description: Forms of drama can influence the outcome of the story being represented.

1280DF9240404EDC9C1A7C23662BD7B6.description: Poetry can be explored to build a foundation of cultural knowledge and a sense of historical continuity.

5342B952662245CCBAD35C989DCBAF21.description: Non-fiction texts have structures that support factual information that can be analyzed for accuracy.

342C284222B345B68D8D6CB24297B367.description: Engaging with fictional texts can develop empathy and inspire creativity.

A3E33EBB04A04A039AAD12D241BF59B3.description: Text features are used to navigate, enhance, or create complex information in an efficient manner.

36BF8B65D5AD4555AB1158CA1C8AB18F.description: Text genres, forms, and structures can enhance and influence the enjoyment and communication of ideas and information.

4BD49883ADDF461E99EA433A62DA658D.description: Land is a text that can be read for multiple meanings and understandings.

9B45D2B0F94041BE94BC7A3FC30D7893.description: Human-made structures of land convey meaning, such as First Nations pictographs, First Nations petroglyphs, Inuit inuksuit, M�tis lobsticks, Coastal First Nations totem poles, Pyramids (Egyptian and Mesoamerican), Stonehenge, Neolithic burial mounds, Cave paintings at Lascaux and Chauvet and Mesopotamian dams and dikes.

AC5D341818DE4A188E903E687AE70581.description: A tragedy is a serious story with an unhappy ending.

F237D70BF0F84DEDBB414C35E501CB94.description: A comedy is a humorous story with a happy ending.

3E5EF743B39E4346A9EE0F8AF909C425.description: Forms of drama include comedy and tragedy.

65CFF73527414969860E57D8250A0040.description: Poetic structures include ballads, poems, or songs narrating stories in short stanzas.

92B4A84C47D94627A95D8703A7EF96C6.description: The content and source of information should be analyzed for factual accuracy.

3E08BF0D2869450DB2836F28E4F082DA.description: Non-fiction texts can have a variety of structures, including problem and solution.

F1960EF6878C43329F81386AB1C5B8E9.description: An antagonist is an opponent of or force acting against the protagonist and often gets in the protagonist �s way or creates challenges.

960E9B14D34B4A01B98C25B88BD54092.description: A protagonist is the main character at the centre of a story who makes decisions, deals with consequences, and faces obstacles.

F2EA78DC37D243C981C90194E2D99196.description: A stock character is a stereotypical figure who is recognized from familiar literature and traditions.

EC917BAC02B2431FB5174020057A4812.description: Types of characters include stock, protagonist and antagonist.

1E3ECA47481F42638D7B27C585645117.description: Elements of fiction include conflict, which is a struggle between individuals, groups, or forces that prevents the protagonist from achieving a goal.

1D0CB7C10C1C4BEABFAFAEF1CFBE2297.description: Fictional texts can have a variety of structures, including a story within a story.

CB59D731609C42C6A09FC2A379ED6AEA.description: Comedic text is amusing in tone and often has a cheerful ending.

AAAD54AE9CAB4F7481FBF8F20DAB6412.description: Fiction sub-genres include traditional literature and comedy.

F164A4447A6D426C9B37B301452C4596.description: Text features can be digital or non-digital and can organize and present important content, enhance comprehension of content and expand vocabulary.

59A4F3AFA90241CF8070643904FB54B2.description: Narrative texts can be fiction or non-fiction and can be structured in a variety of ways to create effect.

E5AA1C97B39349A4AB0B32A5C7D4E024.description: Literary text forms can be digital or non-digital and include articles, speeches and hybrids.

6225B1D08DA947A4A4B8A4AC2086B3E2.description: Literary texts can be categorized by genre, including fiction and non-fiction.

75241884D78D454B81380449C0905853.description: Reading a variety of texts for enjoyment can support academic development.

46F7F92BABD143B8B24C3A929DEB5FB4.description: Texts can have more than one purpose and may have one that stands out.

405E48D7F22240ECA21CA3DB2643AB77.description: Students analyze how text form and structure clarify information and support connecting with self, others, and the world.

5B136935B4C74E668A00EC7F03C5D5D4.description: Text Forms and Structures: Identifying and applying text forms and structures improves understanding of content, literary style, and our rich language traditions.
